item.title: About Author
item.description: Babak Tourani Currently: Data Engineer at Vonage (previously known as Nexmo) Databases: Oracle, Redshift, Snowflake Workflow Orchestrators: Airflow, Oozie Languages: [PL/]SQL, Python, Java Formerly: TV/Radio presenter and producer (BBC World Service) Basketball Coach. Assistant Coach of Iran’s Basketball Team

item.title: Disclaimer
item.description: Dear Reader! I hereby declare that the material published in this blog have no other purpose, but to remind me about those aspects of the technologies that I use on a daily basis - to earn money, primarily - but I tend to forget quickly. Also I hope that the posts could help finding [possible] solutions easier on the web, by simply spreading the word, and increasing the exposure of posts’ subjects to search engines such as Google.

item.title: Nobody Reads Your Blog!
item.description: Yes, nobody! I mean: REALLY read it; going through all the words and sentences and paragraphs and get through to the end. During the time that I was working for BBC World Service (2002-2012) one of the more important guidelines for online content producers was: “All you have to play with is the first page, and in fact, first paragraph of your piece. You have to grab your audience’s attention there, and say whatever you want to say in the top part of the page, before the user needs to scroll down, because they rarely do!
